findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 17 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including entities with no active directors or facing strike-off. The highest breach spend of all 4 East Lancashire councils.

findings.label: CH Breach: B3P, JDS & Homewise
findings.detail: Three suppliers with no active directors or PSC received a combined £866K. B3P Services Ltd alone received £420K with no directors registered.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 670 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week. Many may be legitimate phased payments, but the volume warrants review.

findings.label: Micro-Transactions to HM Land Registry
findings.detail: 2,422 payments averaging just £5 each. While legitimate, this volume suggests batch processing that could be consolidated for efficiency.

findings.label: Year-End Spending Pattern
findings.detail: March is actually Hyndburn's lowest-spending month (0.6x average). July is the peak. No evidence of year-end budget rush — a sign of good financial discipline.

key_findings.title: B3P Services Ltd: £420.2K paid — no active directors
key_findings.description: Company has no active directors registered at Companies House. Council continued payments despite non-compliance.

key_findings.title: JDS Trucks Ltd: £287.3K paid — no directors or PSC
key_findings.description: No active directors and no Person of Significant Control registered. Beneficial ownership completely obscured.

key_findings.title: Homewise Society Ltd: £158.6K paid — no directors or PSC
key_findings.description: No active directors and no Person of Significant Control registered. Beneficial ownership completely obscured.

key_findings.title: HM Land Registry: 2,422 transactions totalling £12K
key_findings.description: Averaging £5 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier by volume. Legitimate but administratively heavy.

key_findings.title: 35 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £27.4M total
key_findings.description: Capita, Alliance Leisure, Lancashire County Council and 32 others serve multiple East Lancashire councils. Compare pricing across all 4 councils.

key_findings.title: Alliance Leisure: £12.6M at Hyndburn vs £24.6K at Pendle
key_findings.description: Hyndburn pays £204K avg per transaction vs Pendle £12.3K. Likely reflects different contract scopes — Hyndburn's leisure centre investment programme vs ad-hoc purchases.
